formattedAddress: 292 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 292 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text: THESE GUYS ARW CROOKS AND NOT RECOMMEND NO ONE TO DEAL WITH THIS PLACE!!!!! Not only were they rude and degrading in price but also not good business people. They're out to rip people off an rob you of your sneakers, give you scraps an sell your shoes for a crazy amount. They sell used sneakers for ridiculous prices an rip you off an lie when you go to sell new sneakers. Stay away from this place an sell your shoes online or flight club. Reporting to BBB

originalText.text:
Well, considering all the bad reviews, I'm writing to give a good review.  From my own personal experiences, they practice business just like any other business, prime example, Jewelry Stores.  My customer service is great with Sneaker Pawn and my son loves the store, it's called knowing how to work & communicate with people to get the best price. I've brought my son (13yrs) plenty of sneakers from Sneaker Pawn, all less than $120. I even brought my son a Gucci Suede track suit for his 13th birthday made by Dapper Dan.  Now where u going to find that! They will work with you on the price for sure, just ask. Not sure what selling experience is, so no comments there.  Sometimes you have to put the service in the customer....meaning provide them with the service of buying products from their store and become an avid shopper and then in return, I'm sure, you will get the customer service and the price you are looking for.  Everyday life is a hustle!
Alicia Broaddus (KYHU)

originalText.text: I went into the store to ask a sales associate as to whether or not they take Ugg boots. They told me they do. Came back the next day with the merchandise. I was supposed to get back money however will have to come back in the next 5 days. When I went back, they told me they have give me back the merchandise due to not able to give me the money!!!! Why took the merchandise in the 1st place???!! Too many miscommunication as well no one knows exactly what to do. Stay away from Sneaker Pawn

originalText.text: YES HE DID! Chase Reed,is selling used basketball sneakers.... What is amazing: Chase is an 17 years old High school student! A friendly New York Start/Up

originalText.text: Good luck getting in touch with them. They don't pick up calls and close the store before business hours. I drove an hour just to find the store closed at 6:30pm when it clearly says 8pm. Not shopping here again.
